weapons

Class Weapon

  • java.lang.Object
    • weapons.Weapon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, SwapEffect
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Blunderbuss, DeathRay, Dessenger, Fisticuffs, Flamethrower, Hawk, Minigun, Scylla, Shadowblade, ShurikenWeapon, StormSurge, WoMD

    public abstract class Weapon
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, SwapEffect
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Weapon

        public Weapon(double damage,
              int fireRate,
              int magazine,
              int pierce,
              float projSpeed,
              int reloadSpeed)
        Abstract constructor for NORMAL type
        Parameters:
        damage - Default damage of each Projectile created by the Weapon
        fireRate - Amount of frames that must elapse between each Projectile release
        magazine - Amount of projectiles that can be fired before needing reload.
        pierce - Amount of enemies the Projectiles released from this weapon can pass through.
        projSpeed - Pixels covered in one frame by projectile released
        reloadSpeed - Amount of frames that must elapse to finish a reload

      • Weapon

        public Weapon(double damage,
              int fireRate,
              int pierce,
              float projSpeed)
        Abstract constructor for MELEE Weapon types
        Parameters:
        damage - Default damage of each Projectile created by the Weapon
        fireRate - Amount of frames that must elapse between each Projectile release
        pierce - Amount of enemies the Projectiles released from this weapon can pass through.
        projSpeed - Pixels covered in one frame by projectile released

      • Weapon

        public Weapon(double damage,
              int fireRate,
              int magazine,
              float projSpeed,
              int reloadSpeed)
        Abstract constructor for BEAM Weapon types
        Parameters:
        damage - Default damage of each Projectile created by the Weapon
        fireRate - Amount of frames that must elapse between each Projectile release
        magazine - Amount of projectiles that can be fired before needing reload.
        projSpeed - Pixels covered in one frame by projectile released
        reloadSpeed - Amount of frames that must elapse to finish a reload

    • Method Detail

      • shoot

        public void shoot()
        Releases all projectiles the weapon normally creates. If the weapon is Melee Type, it will not consume ammunition, but otherwise, will remove a value from the weapon's current magazine. Uses the abstract method createProjectile()

      • createProjectile

        public abstract java.util.ArrayList<Projectile> createProjectile()
        Used for creating an ArrayList of Projectile Objects. Can contain multiple and of varying types.This method is called when the weapon shoots and is added to the Gamepanel's Projectile ArrayList through the spawnProjectile() method.
        Returns:
        Custom ArrayList with projectiles.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - null values will create a NullPointerException

      • timer

        public void timer()
        Handles the basic timers of the weapon, including the reload timer, shot delay, and setting ability to fire if these values are equal to 0. Will be called every frame

      • reload

        public void reload()
        Instantly refills the magazine field to be equal to the magazineMax field. Also sets the reload timer to its maximum value.

      • reset

        public final void reset()
        Resets the magazine to its original state

      • swapTo

        public void swapTo()
        Specified by:
        swapTo in interface SwapEffect

      • swapFrom

        public void swapFrom()
        Specified by:
        swapFrom in interface SwapEffect
